lead_paragraph: Russia’s 10 wealthiest businessmen have donated $12 million to a fund that will pay bonuses to Russian athletes who win medals at the Beijing Olympics. Gold, silver and bronze medalists already receive $25,000, $15,000 and $10,000 from the government. The additional amount each medalist will receive has not yet been determined, said Alexander Katushev of the Fund to Support Olympians.
